item.title: Carol add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Carol add a quote by Ford Maddox Ford
item.description: "Open the book to page ninety-nine and read, and the quality of the whole will be revealed to you." -- Ford Maddox Ford

item.title: Carol add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It's still National Library Week. You should be especially nice to a librarian today, or tomorrow. Sometime this week, anyway. Probably the librarians would like tea. Or chocolates. Or a reliable source of funding." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Carol add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Carol add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "Thousands have lived without love, not one without water." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Carol add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "Let us tenderly and kindly cherish therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write ." -- John Adams

item.title: Carol add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Carol add a quote by Alton Brown
item.description: "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a cash advance." -- Alton Brown

item.title: Carol add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "If liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear." -- George Orwell

item.title: Carol add a quote by George Will
item.description: "Football combines two of the worst things in American life. It is violence punctuated by committee meetings." -- George Will

item.title: Carol add a quote by Isak Dinesen
Carol add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Carol add a quote by The Shadow
item.description: "The weed of crime bears bitter fruit." -- The Shadow

item.title: Carol add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I'm seventeen and I'm crazy. My uncle says the two always go together. When people ask your age, he said, always say seventeen and insane." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Carol add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Painting is not made to decorate apartments. It's an offensive and defensive weapon against the enemy. (about Guernica)." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Carol add a quote by William Golding
item.description: "Language fits over experience like a straight jacket." -- William Golding

item.title: Carol add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Carol add a quote by Edmund Wilson
item.description: "No two persons ever read the same book." -- Edmund Wilson

item.title: Carol add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Carol add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "I believe that a scientist looking at nonscientific problems is just as dumb as the next guy." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Carol add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Carol add a quote by Sholem Aleichem
item.description: "No matter how bad things get, you've got to go on living, even if it kills you." -- Sholem Aleichem

item.title: Carol add a quote by Kurt Weill
item.description: "Who is the greater criminal: he who robs a bank or he who founds one? (Three Penny Opera)" -- Kurt Weill

item.title: Carol add a quote by Arthur Stanley Eddington
item.description: "Not only is the universe stranger than we imagine - it is stranger than we can imagine." -- Arthur Stanley Eddington

item.title: Carol add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Carol add a quote by Julia Spencer-Fleming
item.description: "He stomped away like a pint-sized Godzilla looking for Tokyo." -- Julia Spencer-Fleming

item.title: Carol add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Carol add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "We had a Corsican wine that had great authority and a low price. It was a very Corsican wine and you could dilute it by half with water and still receive its message. A Moveable Feast" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Carol add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "Women's total instinct for gambling is satisfied by marriage" -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Carol add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "Although I'm only fourteen, I know quite well what I want, I know who is right and who is wrong. I have my opinions, my own ideas and principles, and although it may sound pretty mad from an adolescent, I feel more of a person than a child, I feel quite indepedent of anyone." -- Anne Frank
